Is that not against the law also??? I am pretty sure that leeches need to be from Saskatchewan. Not sure how you would ever get caught though!! Clarkie

But what about those frozen minnows?? Nobody has experience??
But what about those frozen minnows?? Nobody has experience??

Going To Tobin for the first time October 8 thru the 12 and could use a little help..were staying green grove motel in Nipawin. but from there all I really know is Deep Reef Runners along the river channel.... any colors or other tips would help out a lot Thanks to all the help...... Gary
Try lindy rigging or jiging with big leeches. I'll be there too blue/grey 2090 bt warrior
Ill be running a 1895 Yarcraft storm maroon and white yamaha motors thanks for the tip
Are leaches readily available in Nipawin? Thanks
I would think like hen's teeth at that time of the year unless a retailer is storing them over for the October tournament. W5
Usually are some available around town....although this year may be a little tougher....I heard it was a tough spring for trappers. Good luck! Clarkie
I just got a reply from the tobin lake resort.. they said that it will be very hard to find leaches anywere as this year was not good at all for the trappers..
Thanks for the replys, I thought they would be tough to find. Anyone try the frozen minnows with much success??
Leeches are a must......I have been babysitting a couple pounds of big ones for the last 2 months to have just for the river. I'll be there 4,5 & 6th and post results if I can.
